codes.title: General error or missing resource
codes.summary: A command reported a generic failure, often because an expected file or argument was missing.
tips: Verify the path or arguments passed to the command.
List files with `ls` to confirm the resource exists and that you have read access.

codes.title: JSON parsing failed
codes.summary: jq could not parse the provided JSON input.
tips: Validate the JSON with an online or offline validator before piping it to jq.
Use `jq . file.json` to confirm the file is valid JSON before applying filters.

codes.title: Command invoked cannot execute
codes.summary: The shell found the command but could not execute it, usually because the file is not marked executable.
tips: Check permissions with `ls -l` and ensure the execute bit is set.
Run `chmod +x <file>` to mark scripts as executable if you trust them.

codes.title: Command not found
codes.summary: The shell could not locate the command name you entered.
tips: Check for typos in the command name.
Run `which <command>` or `apt search` to confirm the tool is installed.

codes.title: Process terminated by user
codes.summary: The command ended after receiving an interrupt signal (Ctrl+C).
tips: Re-run the command when you are ready for it to finish.
Use `nohup` or `tmux` if you need long-running commands to survive interrupts.
